content.description: A low seam that starts wide on the right then thins up as you traverse left; top out above the 'TM' graffiti and don't dab on the  blocks to the left. Depending on the beef of your hands, may feel harder than the grade.
content.protection: At least one pad for the uneven landing below the finish
content.location: Just  the boulder next over east across from the hard routes of Top Rock.

content.description:
This is the big block just to the right of Iron Lion. Walk into the little corridor that houses Mighty Mouse. 

  This route is the arete just next to the big tree. Start with both hands in the horizontal crack and climb the left arete. When the arete gets close to the tree, youre able to trend rightwards a bit on edges then up to the top.
content.protection: The landing is relatively flat so you'll only need 1 to 2 pads.

content.description: An arete line on the south edge of the boulder marked by 'VAPE' graffiti.
content.location: Across from the route marked by 'Jon+Jesse' graffiti, direct north block of Top Rock.

content.description: Start up on the ramp with solid hand jams in the overhanging crack.  Climb over the roof as the crack gets thinner.  Might seem harder if you cant jam
content.protection: a pad or two, and a spotter
content.location: Just to the right of Top Rock boulder/cliff.  It will be on your right as you walk around it, before you get to the chimneys in the back.

content.description: A big boulder with an obvious west-facing line.
content.location: The west face of the pillar immediately north of Top Rock.

content.description: Climb arete under Top Rock starting on large blocky rock. highball with pinches, pockets, slopers.
content.protection: pads on ground, pad on rock, spotters

content.description: Top Rock proper, the cluster of boulders that is home of the Iron Lion and a number of easier problems.
